person_det.title: Person Detection
person_det.info:
Person detection is the foundation for many subsequent application scenarios, and can be used in the following scenarios with person detection algorithms

Security Monitoring

- Crowd counting
- Abnormal behavior detection
- Area intrusion detection

Smart Retail

- Customer flow analysis
- Queue length detection
- Shopping behavior analysis

Intelligent Transportation

- Pedestrian detection
- Traffic flow statistics
- Red light violation detection

Smart Home

- Home security
- Elderly fall detection
- Baby monitoring

person_keypoint_det.title: Human Keypoint Detection
person_keypoint_det.info:
Smart fitness and sports analysis

- Posture correction and movement guidance
- Sports performance analysis and evaluation
- Remote fitness coaching system

Medical rehabilitation

- Patient motor function assessment
- Rehabilitation training progress tracking
- Remote medical guidance

person_falldown_det.title: Fall Detection
person_falldown_det.info: Detect humans in the scene and determine if they are in a falling state

person_hand_det.title: Hand Detection
person_hand_det.info:
Detect human hands in the scene 
 Best performance when about 50cm from K230

person_hand_keypoint_det.title: Hand Keypoint Detection
person_hand_keypoint_det.info:
Detect keypoints of human hands in the scene 
 [Single hand] 
 Best performance when about 50cm from K230

person_hand_keypoint_cla.title: Hand Keypoint Classification
person_hand_keypoint_cla.info:
Recognize basic gestures through classification of hand keypoints 
 [Single hand] 
 Best performance when about 50cm from K230

person_finger_guessing.title: Rock Paper Scissors Game
person_finger_guessing.info:
Click the button to start the game
Uses best-of-three mechanism, please ensure only one hand appears in the scene

person_hand_recog.title: Gesture Recognition
person_hand_recog.info: This example demonstrates basic gesture recognition on K230

face_det.title: Face Detection
face_det.info:
Detect face positions in video
Face detection is the foundation for subsequent face recognition, face keypoint recognition and other functions

face_keypoint_recog.title: Face Keypoint Recognition
face_keypoint_recog.info:
Recognize keypoint information of faces in video
 [Single person] 
Keypoint recognition is used in many scenarios, here are some common use cases:
- Feature point extraction for expression recognition
- Facial feature localization for age estimation
- Feature reference for gender determination 
 - VTuber facial capture

face_dirt_recog.title: Face Direction Recognition
face_dirt_recog.info:
This example demonstrates recognizing the direction of faces in the scene.
 [Single person] 
 Applicable scenarios:


 Driving safety monitoring

- Detect if driver is looking ahead
- Identify head movements during drowsy driving
- Analyze driver distraction behavior

Human-computer interaction

- VR/AR headset tracking
- Gaze tracking control
- Smart device adaptive viewing angle

Security monitoring

- Abnormal behavior recognition
- Attention analysis
- Crowd flow direction statistics

face_3d_net.title: 3D Face Detection
face_3d_net.info:
This example demonstrates using K230 to implement 3D face mesh rendering.
 [Single person] 
 Commonly used for:


 Security authentication - More precise facial recognition system, harder to spoof than 2D recognition, suitable for high-security locations or device unlocking.

Medical field - Can be used for plastic surgery planning, facial abnormality analysis, and medical research.

Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality - Precisely capture user facial expressions, providing more immersive virtual experiences.

Smart retail - Customer facial analysis can provide personalized shopping experiences and recommendations.

Emotion analysis - Analyze user emotions by capturing subtle facial expression changes.

Video games and entertainment - Map player facial expressions to game characters.

Telemedicine - Doctors can conduct preliminary diagnosis through 3D facial scanning.

Virtual makeup/virtual glasses try-on - Provide more accurate virtual try-on experiences.

Note that when applying these technologies, special attention should be paid to privacy protection and data security issues to ensure ethical use of technology.

face_look_det.title: Gaze Direction Detection
face_look_det.info:
This example demonstrates using K230 to implement eye gaze direction detection.
 [Single person] 
 Commonly used for:


 Driving safety monitoring - Detect if driver is looking at the road, prevent drowsy or distracted driving.

User experience research - Analyze user gaze patterns when browsing websites or apps, optimize interface design.

Smart advertising systems - Evaluate advertising attention effectiveness, analyze user focus on advertising content.

Assisted medical diagnosis - Help detect certain neurological diseases or attention disorders.

Augmented reality interaction - Enable intuitive control and navigation through eye tracking.

Education and training - Evaluate learner attention distribution and learning patterns.

Retail analytics - Understand consumer visual focus points in stores.

Disability assistive technology - Provide eye-movement based control systems for mobility-impaired users.

Security authentication systems - As part of biometric identification, enhance identity verification security.

Note that applications of such technology need to balance convenience with privacy protection, ensuring user data security and informed consent.

face_recog_register.title: Face Registration
face_recog_register.info:
This example is used to register faces for recognition:
Please place the faces to be recognized in the [/data/face_register/] directory
Then click the Boot button, K230 will start training face data
The trained face data will be saved to the [/data/face_database/] directory.
 ** The above paths are default save paths, you can adjust path information in the configuration file
face_recog_register.modal_info:
Confirm to start scanning and registering face data?
[Click OK button, buzzer sounds to indicate training start, screen cannot be operated during this time, after training ends the buzzer will sound twice more, screen returns to normal]
 About to register the following faces:
face_recog_register.modal_error: An error occurred while reading face data:
face_recog_register.modal_error_no_data: No face data found, please confirm there are face photos in the current set directory and files are named with person's name
face_recog_register.modal_train_error: Training failed, error message as follows:

face_recog.title: Registered Face Recognition
face_recog.info:
This example is used to recognize registered faces
 [Single person] 
[Note] Before using face recognition, please first use the face registration function to register face data
face_recog.modal_info_no_face: There is currently no registered face data in the face database, please first use the [Face Registration] example to save face data information

ocr_det.title: OCR Detection
ocr_det.info:
[In large programs, detects up to four OCR text segments in the scene] 
 What is OCR?
- OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is an AI technology used to convert text in images into editable digital text.

Common application scenarios
- Document digitization
- ID card, driver's license and other document recognition
- Invoice and receipt processing
- Business card information extraction
- License plate recognition

ocr_recog.title: OCR Recognition
ocr_recog.info:
[In large programs, detects up to four OCR text segments in the scene] 
 Based on OCR detection, let's implement OCR recognition

What is OCR?
- OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is an AI technology used to convert text in images into editable digital text.

Common application scenarios
- Document digitization
- ID card, driver's license and other document recognition
- Invoice and receipt processing
- Business card information extraction
- License plate recognition

yolov8n_seg.title: Yolov8n Segmentation
yolov8n_seg.info:
Image segmentation is a fundamental task in computer vision,
its goal is to divide an image into multiple regions with specific semantic meaning.

Image segmentation tasks require AI systems to identify which category or object each pixel in the image belongs to.
Compared to image classification tasks that only identify what objects exist in an image,
image segmentation requires more precise determination of object location and boundaries.

yolov8n_det.title: Yolov8n Object Detection
yolov8n_det.info:
Vehicles
bicycle, car, motorcycle, airplane, bus, train, truck, boat

Traffic facilities
traffic light, fire hydrant, stop sign, parking meter

Animals:
bird, cat, dog, horse, sheep, cow, elephant, bear, zebra, giraffe

Personal items:
backpack, umbrella, handbag, tie, suitcase

Sports equipment:
frisbee, skis, snowboard, sports ball, kite, baseball bat, baseball glove, skateboard, surfboard, tennis racket

Dining items:
bottle, wine glass, cup, fork, knife, spoon, bowl

Food:
banana, apple, sandwich, orange, broccoli, carrot, hot dog, pizza, donut, cake

Home items:
bench, chair, couch, potted plant, bed, dining table, toilet, vase

Electronic devices:
tv, laptop, mouse, remote, keyboard, cell phone, microwave, oven, toaster, sink, refrigerator, hair drier

Others:
book, clock, scissors, teddy bear, toothbrush

car_license_plate_recog.title: License Plate Recognition
car_license_plate_recog.info: Detect license plates and recognize license plate content

nanotracker.title: Object Tracking
nanotracker.info:
Run the sample program, align the center frame with the object we want to identify, and wait about 8 seconds

The first 7-8 seconds is the learning and waiting process, during which the frame is green

During the waiting phase, the serial terminal will output a countdown:

After the countdown ends, the frame in the center of the screen will turn red, indicating that K230 has entered the search and tracking phase.

self_learning.title: Self-learning Recognition
self_learning.info:
K230 will first learn the features of a certain object, then perform recognition.
You can set the types of objects to learn in the configuration file,
and specify the directory to save data

 Current settings:
self_learning.choose_mode:
Please select execution mode:
 - In [Recognition Only] mode, the program will skip the learning phase and start recognition directly 
 - In [Learning & Recognition] mode, the program will first learn according to the labels written in the configuration,
and save the learned data to the database set in the configuration file
After the learning phase ends, it will enter the recognition phase

Camera.intro_texts_l2: Click the button below to open camera
Camera.intro_texts_l3: Photos will be saved to specified path

Chat.title: LLM Large Language Model
Chat.no_internet: Please connect to WIFI network first
Chat.prompt: Please answer my questions in the most concise way possible, the more concise the better

barcode_recog.title: Barcode Recognition
barcode_recog.info: This example demonstrates basic barcode recognition using K230

qrcode_recog.title: QR Code Recognition
qrcode_recog.info:
This example demonstrates basic QR code recognition using K230

What's the difference between QR codes and barcodes?
The main differences between QR codes and barcodes lie in encoding method and functionality:
Barcodes are one-dimensional, have smaller capacity, mainly used for product identification, require dedicated devices for scanning;
while QR codes are planar two-dimensional, have larger storage capacity, wider application range, error correction capability,
and can be easily recognized by smartphones,
making QR codes more widely applied in modern digital life.

apriltag_recog.title: AprilTag Recognition
apriltag_recog.info:
[Note: Due to resolution issues, AprilTag recognition performance is poor in GUI programs, please run separate AprilTag examples]
This example demonstrates AprilTag recognition using K230

AprilTag is a two-dimensional barcode for visual recognition, widely used in robot navigation, augmented reality, and camera calibration. It was originally developed by researchers at Georgia Institute of Technology. AprilTag is designed to provide a reliable and easily recognizable tag system that can work efficiently in complex environments.

dmcode_recog.title: Data Matrix Code Recognition
dmcode_recog.info:
This example demonstrates Data Matrix code recognition using K230

Data Matrix code features:

1. Square or rectangular shape, composed of black and white dot matrix
2. Supports small sizes, suitable for small area identification
3. Strong damage resistance, still readable even with 30% damage
4. High encoding density, can store more data

color_recog.title: Color Detection
color_recog.info:
This example demonstrates LAB color space based color detection using K230

Here we use red detection as an example
If you want to detect more other colors, please refer to Yahboom K230 color recognition tutorial

item_count.title: Same Color Object Counting
item_count.info:
Based on color detection algorithms, we can implement some extended functions,
such as counting objects of the same or similar colors
We use the [Coin Generator] tool in the supporting materials to generate random numbers of coin images
For more detailed information please check the tutorial section of this chapter

multi_color_recog.title: Multi-color Recognition
multi_color_recog.info:
This example demonstrates LAB color space based color detection using K230

Supports simultaneous detection and recognition of multiple colors.
 In the example program, we detect red / green / blue three colors as an example

Gallery.NoImage: No images found (only PNG format supported)

alert.on_launch:
Graphics detection related functions have complex operation steps in large programs
For complete experience please refer to corresponding individual examples
Combined with official tutorials for learning and usage
alert.size_too_large:
Due to algorithm factors, running this example requires setting resolution to below 160x120,
 Current resolution setting is too high, set resolution to 160x120 and restart device? 
(You can restore default resolution in [Settings] > [Display Settings])

line_det.title: Line Detection
line_det.info:
Call find_line_segments method to get all line segments in the screen

This method is implemented through Hough transform
Hough transform is a mathematical method for detecting geometric shapes like lines and circles from images.

Practical applications

- Lane detection: Recognizing road markings in autonomous driving

- Document scanning: Finding document boundaries

- Building recognition: Detecting building edge lines

rect_det.title: Rectangle Detection
rect_det.info:
[Updated] CV_lite based rectangle recognition

- Find rectangles in images. Suitable for rectangles that contrast sharply with the background, returns a list of image.rect objects.

- Rectangles with boundary size (by sliding Sobel operator on all pixels on rectangle edges and summing the values) smaller than threshold are filtered from the return list. The correct threshold value depends on your application/scenario.

- Does not support compressed images and bayer images.

circle_det.title: Circle Detection
circle_det.info:
[Updated] CV_lite based circle recognition

- Use Hough transform to find circles in images. Returns a list of image.circle objects.

- The x and y coordinates of circle centers and radius are all in pixels.

- Does not support compressed images and bayer images.

edges_det.title: Edge Detection
edges_det.info:
[Updated] CV_lite based edge detection

- Based on Canny edge detection algorithm, find edges in images.

adc.title: ADC Test
adc.info:
ADC test is used to detect K230's analog input voltage

Please connect analog input voltage to K230's ADC pin

Click start test button to view current analog input voltage value

beep.title: Buzzer Test
beep.info:
Buzzer test is used to check if K230's buzzer works normally

Click start test button to hear the buzzer sound

pwm.title: PWM Test
pwm.info:
PWM test is used to detect K230's PWM output

Please connect PWM output to oscilloscope or LED

Click start test button to view PWM output waveform

rgb.title: RGB LED Test
rgb.info:
RGB test is used to check if K230's RGB LED works normally

Click start test button to see RGB LED color changes

language.title: Language & Language
language.finish_changing: Language switching completed, takes effect after restart

display.title: Display
display.not_support_set_bri: 100% [Current version does not support brightness setting]
display.Choose_resolution_text:
Select camera CH1 channel resolution and restart 
 Under normal circumstances, please use 640x480 normal resolution 
 When running some memory-intensive programs, consider switching to 160x120

WLAN.title: Wireless Network
WLAN.cant_connect_info: If unable to connect to WIFI persistently, try powering off and restart K230 after 5 seconds
WLAN.alert: Currently not connected to WIFI. If this is first use, please manually modify configuration file in SD card, configure WIFI name and password, please refer to Yahboom K230 official tutorial for details
WLAN.not_find:
Cannot find your configured WIFI, 
please manually modify configuration file in SD card, configure WIFI name and password, please refer to Yahboom K230 official tutorial for details

more.title: More Settings
more.content:
Due to K230's limited screen size, we put complete settings here
Note that opening complete settings requires K230 to connect to a WIFI network
Click the [Open More Settings] button below, then find in CanMV IDE serial terminal
more.alert_content: Please place your phone or computer on the same local network as K230, access in browser:
more.more_info_disable:
More settings feature not enabled in current version, please refer to tutorial documentation to manually modify configuration file
Configuration file path:[/sdcard/configs/sys_config.json]
